source: gaze the life out of sb
lemma: gaze the life out of sb
definitions: To stare intensely and fixedly at someone or something for a prolonged period, often to the point of making them uncomfortable or as if trying to extract something from them with one's eyes.
examples: He would gaze the life out of her during their arguments.
The painting seemed to gaze the life out of anyone who looked at it.
Don't gaze the life out of the new intern; it's making them nervous.
